conclusion: Analyze the motion of the blocks and the spring using conservation of momentum and energy.
Work done by friction on block C as it travels distance s_0 is -μmg s_0.
Change in kinetic energy of block C is ΔK = 1/2 m v_f^2 - 1/2 m v_0^2.
By work-energy theorem, -μmg s_0 = 1/2 m v_f^2 - 1/2 m v_0^2.
In a perfectly inelastic collision, blocks stick together after collision.
Conservation of momentum gives mv_f = 2m v_final.
Solving for v_final gives v_final = 1/2 v_f = 1/2 √(v_0^2 - 2μgs_0).
Mechanical energy before collision is E_before = 1/2 m (v_0^2 - 2μgs_0).
Mechanical energy after collision is E_after = m 1/4 (v_0^2 - 2μgs_0).
Mechanical energy loss is ΔE = E_before - E_after = 1/4 m (v_0^2 - 2μgs_0).
Mechanical energy loss during collision between C and B is 1/4 m (v_0^2 - 2μgs_0).
